request_pathways.name: Mail to PO Box 6149, Aloha, OR 97007

access_pathway.primary_pathway_description: Patient must use a general-purpose HIPAA ROI authorization form designed for all releases, selecting 'For my own use' as the purpose.

red_flags: Authorization defaults to remaining in effect until care relationship ends — unusually open-ended duration
All 54 fillable fields lack accessible names, creating screen reader accessibility barriers
bright_spots: Full Spanish-language ROI form available as a standalone translation, not just a bilingual addendum
'For my own use' purpose checkbox explicitly acknowledges patient self-access requests
Granular record type selection with 9+ categories and separate sensitive-information opt-ins
Active document governance with version numbering (v6), effective/revision dates, and Compliance department ownership

findability.rationale: Level 4: Forms found easily via web search with direct links; dedicated Patient Forms page with clear 'Release of Information Forms' section, though Divi JS click handlers and a broken Spanish URL are minor friction points.

technical_accessibility.rationale: Level 4: Fillable interactive PDF with 54 form fields allows digital completion, but submission requires fax or mail — one gap in an otherwise digital workflow.

content_design.rationale: Level 4: Well-organized 2-page form with logical flow, clear section headers, granular record selection, and mostly plain language; minor issues include a grammatical error and unnamed fillable fields.

patient_centeredness.rationale: Level 3: A patient can use the generic ROI form for self-access via the 'For my own use' checkbox, but the form is designed around inter-provider exchange and the patient must navigate fields (recipient provider, direction of release) that don't apply to simple record retrieval.

compliance.rationale: Level 4: No illegitimate barriers, clear revocation process, 30-day processing commitment, and right-to-refuse statement; minor ambiguities include no explicit Right of Access citation and an unusually open-ended default authorization duration.

overall.summary: Virginia Garcia provides easy-to-find, well-designed fillable forms in English and Spanish with no illegitimate barriers, but lacks a dedicated patient access pathway, funneling patients through a generic HIPAA authorization form.
